ygData.subject: Re: Murderous Merchant In Akanon.
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry to hear that mata.   I know that my last mistake of this was in beta. I do not believe the NPC s would kill you for casting a harm spell on yourself, but
ygData.messageBody:
Sorry to hear that mata. I know that my last mistake of this was in beta.
I do not believe the NPC's would kill you for casting a harm spell on
yourself, but it is possible. I see people casting DD spells on themselves
(for some stupid reason) and guards do not attack them. This could be a
bug...report it. Anyway, it is an overall smart idea to not cast those
spells on you or others when NPC's are around.

you have learned as I did ;)

-----Original Message-----
From: Mata [mailto:mata_eq@...]
Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 11:18 AM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Murderous Merchant In Akanon.


From: "Mata" <mata_eq@...>

FYI . . .
I cast ROOT on MYSELF and got killed for it in Felwithe, so NO ROOT at all
in town!!!!


----- Original Message -----
From: Spehar, David J <David.Spehar@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 10:48 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Murderous Merchant In Akanon.


> From: "Spehar, David J" <David.Spehar@...>
>
> I had the same effect. It doesnt attack me and I worship Tunare. Just
> doesnt sell to me. Did this person CAST any spells around the NPC? If
you
> practice ROOT on another person (NPC or PC) they will attack you. I have
> learned this lesson the hard way...via death.
>
> - Ziffnab
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Calyn Dawnwatcher [mailto:wizcalyn@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 10:38 AM
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Murderous Merchant In Akanon.
>
>
> From: "Calyn Dawnwatcher" <wizcalyn@...>
>
> Not true! I am a high elf wizard who worships Tunare. The merchant hates
> me, will not sell to me, but will not attack me either. This was before I
> started hunting in Steamfont, so my faction was not improved the first
time
> I entered.
>
> There is something we are missing in this puzzle.
>
> Calyn of Bristlebane
>
>
> >The merchant is a clockwork merchant--it doesn't have a personal name.
It
> >stands just inside the zone entrance of Ak'Anon, usually very near, if
not
> >right on top of, a clockwork jeweler.
>
> >
> >So, the upshot is, if you chose Tunare as deity, you will be attacked the
> >instant you enter Ak'Anon. You can try running away into the city, but I
> >have never witnessed anyone successful at that. Also, I have once
observed
>
> >this merchant running into a wall farther into the city, but that was
only
> >one time. Every other time I have been into Ak'Anon, it has been right
> >there at the entrance.
> >
>
>
